intro: Viguiera laxa, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are pale purple to white, appearing in clusters. Viguiera laxa is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
